text: Hyman Cohen (January 29, 1931 â€“ February 4, 2021) was an American baseball pitcher who played one season in Major League Baseball (MLB). He played seven games for the Chicago Cubs in 1955. He batted and threw right-handed and served as a relief pitcher. Cohen died on February 4, 2021 at a hospital in Rancho Mirage, California from problems caused by COVID-19, aged 90. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Chicago Cubs players Category:Sportspeople from Brooklyn Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in California
title: Hy Cohen
